table.style: width:100%; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

anchor.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

text.style: font-size:8pt; font-weight:bold; vertical-align:baseline;

font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:3px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:16pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#ffffff; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;

para.text: Integration with an existing system, for example an EPR or RIS, is quite simple. Once the ImageServer has been set up on your network with the Web Viewer components, opening studies is done very simply via a URL with query parameters describing the study (or studies) you want to open.

text.style: font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;

para.text: If your application is entirely web based (e.g. it runs in a web browser), then you would likely just launch a new tab or window with the URL and the study data will be shown in the Silverlight client. Otherwise, if it is simple enough to do in your application, as it is in .NET, you can embed a web browser control in your application, passing it the URL.
The URL for accessing the WebViewer is:

text.style: font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

text.style: font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:italic; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;

para.text: is the host name of the server where the ImageServer web UI components reside

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

text.style: font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold;

para.text: is the virtual directory for the ImageServer application.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

text.style: font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:italic; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;

para.text: is any one of the parameters discussed below

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:19px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:14pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:italic; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000080; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;

para.text: There are two sets of parameters that are required in order to use the WebViewer: authentication parameters and WebViewer initialization parameters. The parameters that can be used to construct the URL are shown in the tables below:

text.style: font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; vertical-align:baseline;

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#9d9da1; border-style:solid; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

text.style: font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;

para.text: The username/id that should be used to authenticate against the ClearCanvas Enterprise Server

text.style: font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;

para.text: The password that should be used to authenticate against the ClearCanvas Enterprise Server

text.style: font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;

para.text: Optional. Value is "true" or "false". If specified, the WebViewer will check if there is more than one study for the provided parameters and will display a study list with all of the studies found.

text.style: font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;

para.text: The name of the application that is logging in (e.g. ImageServer, EPR). Note that this can be optionally specified as part of the WebViewerInitString.

text.style: font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;

para.text: The parameters that the WebViewer will use to open a study, described below.

text.style: font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; vertical-align:baseline;

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#9d9da1; border-style:solid; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:#999999; alt-row-background-color:none;

text.style: font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent;
font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;

para.text: The name of the application that is logging in (e.g. ImageServer, EPR). Note that this can be optionally specified as part of the WebViewerInitString.

text.style: font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;

para.text: The Accession# of the study to be opened; normally, when the existing system is a RIS or EPR, this is the only parameter that will be specified

text.style: font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;

para.text: The MRN/ID of the patient, all of whose studies will be opened

text.style: font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;

para.text: The DICOM Study Instance UID of a study to be opened

text.style: font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;

para.text: If necessary, the DICOM Application Entity title of the DICOM server (or ImageServer partition) the studies should be loaded from

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:19px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:14pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:italic; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000080; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;
font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold;

para.text: will attempt to login given the authentication parameters provided (as discussed above). If the login is unsuccessful, an error message will be displayed. If successful,

text.style: font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold;

para.text: will redirect to Default.aspx in the same directory, which, because there is a valid session, will load the WebViewer and display the specified study. There are two methods of authenticating, using the query string, or HTTP POST.

text.style: font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold;

para.text: The required login parameters can be provided on a query string as in the following example:
This will start a session using the provided values, and load the WebViewer with the study displayed. In the case that there are multiple studies, and the

text.style: font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold;

para.text: parameter is provided, then a study list will be displayed where the user can select the study that they want to view.

text.style: font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold;

para.text: A page can be created using standard text/password inputs and/or hidden input fields that posts into the URL above.

text.style: font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold;

para.text: will retrieve the parameters from the POST and attempt to create a session, then load the WebViewer and display the specified study. The following sample uses hidden input fields to automatically open the WebViewer:

para.text: Note also that any errors logging in or authorizing will not compromise the security of the studies. All errors that occur will cause the WebViewer screen to be blacked out, and an error message displayed.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:19px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:14pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:italic; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000080; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;

para.text: The WebViewerInitParams parameter is used by the WebViewer to open the desired study. As mentioned previously, multiple parameters, even the same one, can be specified to the WebViewer. Each parameter/value pair must be separated either by a semicolon (;) or a comma (,). Here are some examples of initialization strings that can be provided to the WebViewer:

text.style: font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#9d9da1; border-style:solid; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

text.style: font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;

para.text: Opens study with Study Instance UID 1.2.3.4

text.style: font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;

para.text: Opens studies for patient with MRN/ID 12345678

text.style: font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;

para.text: Opens studies for patients whose ID begins with 1234567

text.style: font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;

para.text: Opens study 1.2.3.4 from a specific server/partition, MYSERVER

text.style: font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;

para.text: The following rules apply to the accession, patientid and study parameters:

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

text.style: font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;

para.text: Multiple values can be specified by appending the same parameter (with a different value) to the URL

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

text.style: font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

text.style: font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;

para.text: Although it is not common practice, the DICOM wilcard character, *, can be present in the values

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

text.style: font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;

para.text: Often the values contain spaces, which is supported

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

text.style: font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;

para.text: Opening via a patient ID or accession# can result in multiple studies being opened. In this case, the most recent study will be shown in the viewer and others are available via the right-click context menu

text.style: font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;
font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;

para.text: For all other parameters (application and aetitle), only a single value can be specified.

text.style: font-size:11pt; vertical-align:baseline;

para.text: Although you can combine different parameters, like patientid and accession, they are processed independently and it is not common practice to do so.

text.style: font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; vertical-align:baseline;

para.text: Loading of prior studies is handled entirely by the web viewer's application server and does not have to be done by your application, so most often you will just specify a single accession# or patient ID in the URL.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:19px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
